intro: Licania aubletiana, commonly known as the golden balsa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. Licania aubletiana is also valued for its lightweight wood, which has been historically used in boat building.
